alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 01 at 1:37PM MDT until November 02 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Are Expected Again Wednesday... .The Red Flag Warning for today (Tuesday November 1st) continues for Kit Carson and Yuma counties through 6pm MDT. For Wednesday November 2nd, the Fire Weather Watch along and south of Interstate 70 has been upgraded to a Red Flag Warning; north of Interstate 70 the Fire Weather Watch remains. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 252 AND 253... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 6 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 253... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Red Flag Warning for low relative humidity and gusty winds, which is in effect from noon to 6 PM MDT Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson. * Timing... 12pm through 6pm MDT * Winds...South 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...Around 13 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
